sentence.Network_en: The sub-plots are only tenuously interconnected.
sentence.Network_cn: 次要情节之间的联系有点牵强。

sentence.Network_en: His works tenuously survive in the minds of a few scholars.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的作品仅在几个学者脑中留下了些细微的印象.

list.abs: tenuous 微细的, tenuousness 微细, tenuous 软弱的
tenuous 软弱的, tenuousness 纤细, tenuousness 微细

entry.tran: (联系)脆弱的;(理由)站不住脚的，牵强的;(地位)不稳固的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a connection, a reason, or someone's position as tenuous, you mean that it is very uncertain or weak.

example.ex: The cultural and historical links between the many provinces were seen to be very tenuous...
example.tran: 许多省份之间的文化和历史纽带被认为是很脆弱的。

example.ex: This decision puts the President in a somewhat tenuous position.
example.tran: 这个决定使得总统的位置有些岌岌可危。

sentences.sentence: "his works tenuously survive in the minds of a few scholars"

auth_sentence.content: This country hangs tenuously out on the limb of good luck.
auth_sentence.res_content: This country hangs tenuously out on the limb of good luck.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This country hangs tenuously out on the limb of good luck.
